alert.note: Alert for Concho (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 6:55PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Concho County through 745 PM CDT... At 655 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Vick, or 10 miles west of Eden, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eden, Millersview, The Intersection Of Us- 87 And Ranch Road 2134 and The Intersection Of Us- 83 And Ranch Road 765. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas.
